member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.FrameworkElementExtensions.GetVisibleItems``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement,Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Orientation)
member.summary: Returns the items that are visible in a given container.
member.remarks: This function assumes that items are ordered top-to-bottom or left-to-right; if items are in random positions it won't work
member.typeparam: The type of items being tested
member.param: The items being tested; typically the children of a StackPanel
The viewport to test visibility against; typically a ScrollViewer
Whether to check for vertical or horizontal visibility
member.returns: The items that are (at least partially) visible

member.summary: Returns the items that are visible in a given container plus the invisible ones before and after.
member.remarks: This function assumes that items are ordered top-to-bottom or left-to-right; if items are in random positions it won't work
member.typeparam: The type of items being tested
member.param: The items being tested; typically the children of a StackPanel
The viewport to test visibility against; typically a ScrollViewer
Wether to check for vertical or horizontal visibility
List to be populated with items that precede the visible items
List to be populated with the items that are visible
List to be populated with the items that follow the visible items

member.summary: Returns all the descendents of a particular type
member.param: Whether to stop searching the tree after the first set of items are found
member.returns: List of the element found
member.remarks: The allAtSameLevel flag is used to control enumeration through the tree. For many cases (eg, finding ListBoxItems in a ListBox) you want enumeration to stop as soon as you've found all the items in the ListBox (no need to search further in the tree). For other cases though (eg, finding all the Buttons on a page) you want to exhaustively search the entire tree

member.name: T:MyToolkit.Controls.OrientedSize
member.summary: The OrientedSize structure is used to abstract the growth direction from the layout algorithms of WrapPanel. When the growth direction is oriented horizontally (ex: the next element is arranged on the side of the previous element), then the Width grows directly with the placement of elements and Height grows indirectly with the size of the largest element in the row. When the orientation is reversed, so is the directional growth with respect to Width and Height.

member.name: T:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager
member.summary: SuspensionManager captures global session state to simplify process lifetime management for an application. Note that session state will be automatically cleared under a variety of conditions and should only be used to store information that would be convenient to carry across sessions, but that should be disacarded when an application crashes or is upgraded.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.SaveAsync
member.summary: Save the current . Any instances registered with will also preserve their current navigation stack, which in turn gives their active an opportunity to save its state.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that reflects when session state has been saved.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.RestoreAsync
member.summary: Restores previously saved . Any instances registered with will also restore their prior navigation state, which in turn gives their active an opportunity restore its state.
member.returns: An asynchronous task that reflects when session state has been read. The content of should not be relied upon until this task completes.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.RegisterFrame(MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a instance to allow its navigation history to be saved to and restored from . Frames should be registered once immediately after creation if they will participate in session state management. Upon registration if state has already been restored for the specified key the navigation history will immediately be restored. Subsequent invocations of will also restore navigation history.
member.param: An instance whose navigation history should be managed by
A unique key into used to store navigation-related information.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.UnregisterFrame(MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame)
member.summary: Disassociates a previously registered by from . Any navigation state previously captured will be removed.
member.param: An instance whose navigation history should no longer be managed.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.SessionStateForFrame(MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame)
member.summary: Provides storage for session state associated with the specified . Frames that have been previously registered with have their session state saved and restored automatically as a part of the global . Frames that are not registered have transient state that can still be useful when restoring pages that have been discarded from the navigation cache.
member.remarks: Apps may choose to rely on to manage page-specific state instead of working with frame session state directly.
member.param: The instance for which session state is desired.
member.returns: A collection of state subject to the same serialization mechanism as .

member.name: P:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.SessionState
member.summary: Provides access to global session state for the current session. This state is serialized by and restored by , so values must be serializable by and should be as compact as possible. Strings and other self-contained data types are strongly recommended.

member.name: P:MyToolkit.Paging.MtSuspensionManager.KnownTypes
member.summary: List of custom types provided to the when reading and writing session state. Initially empty, additional types may be added to customize the serialization process.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.GoForwardAsync
member.summary: Tries to navigate forward to the next page.
member.returns: Returns true if navigating forward, false if cancelled

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.GetNearestPageOfTypeInBackStack(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the first page of the specified type in the page back stack or null if no page of the type is available.
member.returns: The page or null if not found.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.GoBackToAsync(MyToolkit.Paging.MtPageDescription)
member.summary: Navigates back to the given page.
member.returns: True if the navigation could be performed.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.GoBackToAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Navigates back to the given index.
member.returns: True if the navigation could be performed.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.GoHomeAsync
member.summary: Navigates back to the first page in the page stack.
member.returns: True if the navigation could be performed.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.GoBackAsync
member.summary: Tries to navigate back to the previous page.
member.returns: Returns true if navigating back, false if cancelled or CanGoBack is false.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.Initialize(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes the frame and navigates to the given first page.
member.param: The type of the home page.
member.returns: Always true.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.NavigateAsync(System.Type)

member.returns: Returns true if the navigation process has not been cancelled.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.Paging.MtFrame.NavigateAsync(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Navigates forward to a new instance of the given page type.
member.returns: Returns true if the navigation process has not been cancelled.

member.name: T:MyToolkit.UI.TemplatedVisualTreeExtensions
member.summary: A static class providing methods for working with the visual tree using generics.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.TemplatedVisualTreeExtensions.GetFirstLogicalChildByType``1(Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the first logical child of a specified type using a breadth-first search. A visual element is assumed to be a logical child of another visual element if they are in the same namescope. For performance reasons this method manually manages the queue instead of using recursion.
member.param: Specifies whether to apply templates on the traversed framework elements
member.returns: The first logical child of the framework element of the specified type.

member.name: M:MyToolkit.UI.TemplatedVisualTreeExtensions.GetLogicalChildrenByType``1(Windows.UI.Xaml.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves all the logical children of a specified type using a breadth-first search. A visual element is assumed to be a logical child of another visual element if they are in the same namescope. For performance reasons this method manually manages the queue instead of using recursion.
member.param: Specifies whether to apply templates on the traversed framework elements
member.returns: The logical children of the framework element of the specified type.
